name: How Corporate Boards Connect, in Charts
creator: Harvard Business Review
description: I have no idea what you call this kind of thing. A node chart? But it was built in D3, largely from scratch, to visualize the global links between corporate boards across a couple decades.

name: The Decline of Yahoo in Its Own Words
creator: Harvard Business Review
description: A visualization of mentions of words relating to mobile technology on earnings calls by Yahoo, Google and Microsoft. Renders as a line chart on large screens and a scrollable heatmap on small screens.

name: IT Insights
creator: Steve Pepple
description: Charts and stats that provide a snapshot of IT mobility.

name: Islamic Terrorist Attacks All over the World, 1983 - 2015
creator: Kirby
description:
A frame work helps you visualize events across time and space with bubbles of magnitude of events. Device friendly.
（The url is an example of visualization of Islamic terrorist attacks from 1983 to 2015.）

name: Fatalities of 63 & 881
creator: FFunction
description:
Canada's Highway 63 and Highway 881 are two of the deadliest routes in and out of Alberta's oil sands, and have seen hundreds of vehicle-related injuries and dozens of fatalities in the last few years. The interactive visualization Fatalities of 63 & 881 takes the user on a virtual trip along these treacherous stretches of road, using the up and down keys or the mouse to guide the car along each highway. Along the way, the interactive pinpoints sites of past fatalities and offers life-saving tips to reduce the risk of crashing, such as putting away your cellphone, turning off cruise control when driving in snowy conditions, and watching out for moose and other wildlife. 

A "joystick" navigation was created for mobile and tablets, to avoid tedious swiping. On the map view and on the victims view, filters were moved to a separate page.

Fatalities of 63 & 881 is a timely reminder that accidents do happen, and aims to encourage safer driving so that less Canadians lose their lives on the road.

name: Workplace Gender Equality Agency Data Explorer
creator: Flink Labs
description: This "data explorer" visualisation has been created using data from 4,354 non-public sector organisations with 100 or more employees that reported to the Workplace Gender Equality Agency for the 2013-14 reporting period.

name: Inside Duncan’s final days
creator: The Associated Press
description: A day-by-day analysis of Ebola patient Thomas Eric Duncan's hospitalization, with details about his care and condition until his death, gathered from medical records provided by his family.

name: Media Watch on Climate Change
creator: ECOresearch Network / MODUL University Vienna
description: The Media Watch on Climate Change is a knowledge aggregator that aims to raise awareness and support new forms of communication and collaboration in the environmental domain. Based on the webLyzard Web intelligence platform (http://www.weblyzard.com), the Media Watch on Climate Change collects, annotates and visualizes documents from English, French and German online sources  including news and social media, Fortune 1000 Web sites and environmental NGOs.

name: A6 Data Analysis
creator: Heilbronner Stimme
description:
Mobile first project about the autobahn 6 in Germany. 

The data analysis is integrated in a huge storytelling concept. The content and data are presented on cards and with animated charts.

name: HP What Matters
creator: FFunction
description: Displayed on touch screens and mobiles at HP Discover Las Vegas, FFunction’s interactive application uses data visualization to showcase the results of a survey of 3 500 IT executives.

name: The new middle-east
creator: Per Byhring, aftenposten.no
description:
A map which shows possible new borders in the middle-east.

A common way of making a map like this for desktop browsers is to add clickable markers with more info. This is generally a bad user experience on mobile devices if there are more than 2-3 clickable markers.

So instead of doing that we adapted the functionality of a standard image-gallery. The reader can swipe left and right to move/zoom to the next information-point on the map.

name: Building Toward Disaster
creator: The Seattle Times
description: This graphic was built to let readers look through the history of the tragic 2014 landslide in Washington's Snohomish County. We tied the timeline to aerial photos, allowing readers to see the movement of the river over time, and provided data on the construction, logging, red flags, and attempted fixes. By pivoting to a vertical timeline, it works well on mobile, tablet, and desktop.

name: Infomous iOS app
creator: Infomous, Inc.
description:
Our native iOS app for news discovery, also includes simple social exploration with Twitter, Facebook, Instagram.

The order of the screenshots is not quite right - it should be 1,3,2,5,6,4.

name: The confidential list of everyone attending Davos this year
creator: Quartz
description: You can explore who’s on the list of 2,630 participants of Davos 2012 by sorting and searching the interactive graphic

name: The state of US trade with Africa as Obama visits
creator: Quartz
description: An interactive map showing the amount of trade the US conducts with every African country

name: Latin America earns more from exporting soccer players than live animals
creator: Quartz
description: When a country exports more value in soccer players than in steaks—like, say, Guatemala—it’s probably an outlier. But when almost an entire region exports more money in soccer players than live animals—like, say, Latin America—it’s a trend.

name: Where the best and worst tippers in America Live
creator: Quartz
description: Payment service Square provided Quartz with data on tens of millions of food-service transactions across the US. This shows that tips for waiters, baristas, and food-truck workers vary significantly according to location.

name: The biggest land rush in the history of the internet starts on February 4
creator: Quartz
description: An interactive to explore the new proposals for top level domain names

name: July US jobs report
creator: Quartz
description: A dashboard of US employment figures that updates as soon as new statistics are released

name: Live India election results
creator: Quartz
description: A visualization of the 2014 Lok Sabha election results that was updated live as results were released.

name: Record-Setting Effort by Howard, but Belgium Ousts U.S.
creator: The New York Times
description: An interactive overview of the BEL & USA World cup game goal attempts

name: Leagues of the World Cup
creator: The Washington Post
description: "Each of the 32 World Cup countries has a professional soccer league, but you wouldn’t know it by looking at some rosters. More than two-thirds of participants in this year’s tournament spend the rest of the year in the powerhouse leagues of Europe."

name: A Rogue State Along Two Rivers
creator: New York Times
description: Interesting responsive "map timeline" that manages to keep the really interesting bits for the mobile layout.

name: 984 Ways the United States Can Advance to the Next Round of the World Cup
creator: The New York Times
description: A table showing the most likely scenarios for the United States to advance to the next round in the World Cup.

name: OECD Regional Well-Being
creator: Moritz Stefaner, Dominikus Baur
description: How does your region perform when it comes to education, environment, safety and other topics important to your well-being? This interactive site allows you to measure well-being in your region and compare it with 300 other OECD regions based on eight topics central to the quality of our lives.

name: Fewer Helmets, More Deaths
creator: The New York Times
description: More states are being pressured to repeal their universal motorcycle helmet laws. But when those laws are changed, the number of fatalities starts to rise immediately.

name: Sun
creator: Jakob Henner
description: A web based mobile only weather application.

name: The Refugee Project
creator: Hyperakt, Ekene Ijeoma, Oak
description: "The Refugee Project is a narrative, temporal map of refugee migrations since 1975. We’ve used UN data to visualize refugee volumes over time and added a layer of historical content to help explain the events that caused some of the largest refugee movements of the last four decades."

name: Reporter App
creator: Nicholas Felton
description: "Reporter is a new application for understanding the things you care about. With a few randomly timed surveys each day, Reporter can illuminate aspects of your life that might be otherwise unmeasurable."

name: A Vision of the Future From Those Likely to Invent It
creator: The New York Times

name: Which Team Do You Cheer For? An N.B.A. Fan Map
creator: The New York Times
description: A US Map colored by the basketball teams being cheered for in those regions

name: For Eli Manning, 150 Games and Counting
creator: The New York Times
description: "On Sunday, Manning will start his 150th consecutive game for the Giants. Below, how his streak compares to the streaks of nearly 500 quarterbacks who have started a game since 1970."

name: Taking the Battle to the States
creator: The New York Times
description: "Republicans or Democrats have single-party control of both the legislature and the governor’s office in 36 states, the most in six decades. Lawmakers in these states have been seeking to reshape government policy in recent years, from legalizing same-sex marriage to restricting labor unions. Some of these laws were passed after the rapid rise of single-party control in 2010; others have been in place for years. Below is a look at where states stand on some key issues."

name: Short Track
creator: The New York Times
description: "On a track crowded with skaters, these racers have to accelerate in the turns and pass when the moment is just right."

name: Front Row to Fashion Week
creator: The New York Times
description: "Of the hundreds of fall 2014 collections shown during New York Fashion Week, here are the ones that left the biggest impressions on fashion editors as they headed off to the next round of shows, in London, Milan and Paris."

name: Who Will Win The Senate?
creator: The New York Times
description: "According to our statistical election-forecasting machine, the Democrats have a slight edge, with about a 61% chance of retaining a majority."

name: Is It Better to Rent or Buy?
creator: The New York Times
description: "The choice between buying a home and renting one is among the biggest financial decisions that many adults make. But the costs of buying are more varied and complicated than for renting, making it hard to tell which is a better deal. To help you answer this question, our calculator takes the most important costs associated with buying a house and computes the equivalent monthly rent. "

name: Bud’s Story, from the Records
creator: Propublica
description: Private Arthur ‘Bud’ Kelder died as a POW in the Philippines during World War II. His parents always hoped that his body would eventually be sent home. But despite clues, the military has never recovered his remains. Here are letters and others documents from his case from 1941 to 1950. The documents and photographs below are either from the National Archive or courtesy of John Eakin."

name: Temp Worker Regulations Around the World
creator: Propublica
description: "The United States has some of the weakest labor protections for temp workers in the developed world. Other countries have adopted regulations limiting the length of temp assignments, guaranteeing equal pay for equal work and restricting companies from hiring temps for hazardous tasks. Here, we map out how countries compare based on data compiled by the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development, which produces research on behalf of the world’s industrialized nations."

name: Mass Surveillance in America: A Timeline of Loosening Laws and Practices
creator: Propublica
description: A historical overview of the changing surveillance laws in America

name: NSA Surveillance Lawsuit Tracker
creator: Propublica
description: "The recent disclosure of sweeping surveillance by NSA whistleblower Edward Snowden has prompted a new wave of legal challenges to the U.S. government's intelligence-gathering programs. Here is a list of key legal challenges to government surveillance and secrecy. "

name: Has the Gov't Lied on Snooping? Let's Go to the Videotape
creator: Propublica
description:
"Since Edward Snowden leaked a trove of documents detailing the NSA's sweeping surveillance programs, Director of National Intelligence James Clapper acknowledged that part of his congressional testimony in March was "erroneous." But that's not the only questionable comment by administration officials about the programs.

Here are six claims by administration officials about NSA surveillance that have been undermined by recent disclosures."

name: School Segregation after Brown
creator: Propublica
description:
"
   Hundreds of school districts were placed under court order to desegregate following the Supreme Court’s 1954 Brown v. Board of Education ruling. Many communities do not know the status of these orders. Use this tool to find out whether your district is or ever was under a desegregation order, and also to look at the levels of integration and segregation in your schools. "

name: The Department of Labor’s Internship Investigations
creator: Propublica
description: "In 2010, the Labor Department issued a new fact sheet clarifying when an intern needs to be paid under federal labor law. We collected the case files for the internship investigations the Labor Department concluded in the three years after issuing new guidelines."

name: Where Congress Stands on Guns
creator: Propublica
description: "In the aftermath of the Newtown tragedy, Congress has considered new national gun control measures. We present where each member of Congress stands on guns."

name: Dialysis: The High Costs and Hidden Perils of a Treatment Guaranteed to All
creator: Propublica
description: "This site is for dialysis patients and others who want to learn about the quality of care at individual dialysis clinics. Among other things, you can learn how often patients treated at a facility have been hospitalized, report certain types of infections or are placed on the transplant list. The information is submitted by facilities and collected by contractors of the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, the federal agency that oversees most dialysis care."

name: Message Machine: Reverse-Engineering the 2012 Campaign
creator: Propublica
description: "Political campaigns send many variations of each email to supporters. We've been collecting emails from political campaigns and tracking the variations. Here you can explore those emails."

name: Dollars for Docs
creator: Propublica
description: "In recent years, drug companies have started releasing details of the payments they make to doctors and other health professionals for promotional talks, research and consulting. As of 2012, 15 companies published the information, most because of legal settlements. Use this tool to search for payments."

name: The Opportunity Gap
creator: Propublica
description: "This database includes all public schools in districts with more than 3,000 students from the 2009-2010 school year -- about three-quarters of all such students in the country. Use it to find out how well your state provides poor and wealthier schools equal access to advanced classes that researchers say will help them later in life."

name: Nursing Home Inspect
creator: Propublica
description:
"By Charles Ornstein and Lena Groeger, ProPublica. Data updated March 2014.

Use this tool to compare nursing homes in a state based on the deficiencies cited by regulators and the penalties imposed in the past three years. You can also search over 60,000 nursing home inspection reports to look for trends or patterns. "

name: How Much Acetaminophen Are You Taking?
creator: Propublica
description: "Many common over-the-counter drugs contain acetaminophen. Taking more than one at the same time increases your chance of “double-dipping” -- accidentally overdosing. Use this tool to find out which of the drugs in your medicine cabinet contains acetaminophen -- and how much. This is not meant to be medical advice. Toxic levels vary by individual. Call your doctor if you think you’ve overdosed, even if you don’t show medical symptoms."

name: How Well Did FEMA's Maps Predict Sandy's Flooding?
creator: Propublica
description: "When Superstorm Sandy struck New York and New Jersey last year, the accuracy of FEMA’s flood-risk maps for the area varied widely. In some cases, the data behind the maps dated as far back to the 1970s. The maps help guide development and set flood insurance rates, so many property owners were left unprepared for the flooding. Click a county below to see more about FEMA’s data for that county, including the age of its maps and how well they predicted Sandy’s extent."

name: ER Wait Watcher
creator: Propublica
description: An emergency room locator paired with a comparison of wait times across states.

name: How Dark Money Flows Through the Koch Network
creator: Propublica

name: One Year, One City
creator: The Boston Globe
description: "On April 15, 2013, their lives intersected at the Marathon. One year later, they returned to the scene for a historic photo shoot."

name: Explore the College of Cardinals
creator: The Boston Globe
description: "With the resignation of Pope Benedict XVI, the College of Cardinals is convening to select the new leader of the Catholic Church. Use this graphic to learn more about the cardinals who will select the next pope."

name: How MIT brainpower returned a dancer to the stage
creator: The Boston Globe
description: "BioM, a Bedford company founded in 2007 by an MIT professor, has created a prosthetic ankle that supplies power during walking and produces a more natural gait. The ankle is fitted based on the amputee’s ideal stride, to minimize gait abnormalities that lead to health problems." In this interactive the user can see how the prosthetic ankle works at different stages of a stride.

name: The Most Stylish Bostonians 2014
creator: The Boston Globe
description: The Globe’s ninth annual list of tastemakers.

name: The new faces of City Hall
creator: The Boston Globe
description: A graphic illustrating the changing structure of the City of Boston under the new Mayor. Interesting examples including print, web and mobile.

name: Obama stayed on-script at DNC
creator: The Boston Globe
description: A comparison between President Obama's prepared remarks to the DNC versus the actual speech.

name: How much water is in your scallop?
creator: The Boston Globe
description: "A Globe investigation of 21 grocery stores and seafood markets across Massachusetts found scallops with water levels far exceeding industry standards."

name: Overhauling the school assignment system
creator: The Boston Globe
description: "Boston school officials have presented five proposals to revamp the city’s school-assignment system. Mayor Thomas M. Menino has said he would like Boston students to be able to attend schools closer to their homes. Here is a look at the plans."

name: Inaugural language
creator: The Boston Globe
description: "American inaugural addresses often cover similar ground. They celebrate American values while looking forward to the future, but the vocabulary has changed over the decades.... The following graphs visualize inaugural addresses words. Each dot represents one word. Darker dots indicate more frequent usage. The graph radius represents duration of speech. Common English words have been removed."

name: ‘Women’ a central theme in Menino’s speech
creator: The Boston Globe
description: Overview of former Boston Mayor Thomas M. Menino's key term usage in State of the City addresses

name: Evolution of a tycoon
creator: The Boston Globe
description: Taxi magnate Edward J. Tutunjian owns by far the largest share of Boston cabs: 372, or one in five. In this visualization we get an idea of the timeline, as well as the size and estimated value of the fleet in the current market.

name: Analyzing ticks, town by town
creator: The Boston Globe
description: A map showing the number of ticks sent in for DNA analysis by towns in MA

name: Obama’s Vineyard
creator: The Boston Globe
description: A look at how President Obama and his family spent their time on Martha’s Vineyard during their 2009, 2010 and 2011 vacations.

name: Homicides in Boston
creator: The Boston Globe
description: Showing homicides in Boston across years and locations

name: Results of the preliminary election for mayor
creator: The Boston Globe
description: Mayoral election results in Boston

name: Votes up for grabs in Boston mayoral race
creator: The Boston Globe
description: The results of Boston's Mayoral Election.

name: Factors considered in an arbitration award
creator: The Boston Globe

name: US House district 5 general election results
creator: The Boston Globe
description: Showing election results in tables.

name: Snow totals in Mass., Northeast
creator: The Boston Globe
description: A mapbox-based map showing snowfall as a choropleth.

name: Treatment Tracker
creator: Propublica
description: Medicare recently released, for the first time, details on 2012 payments to individual doctors and other health professionals serving the 46 million seniors and disabled in its Part B program. Part B covers services as varied as office visits, ambulance mileage, lab tests, and the doctor’s fee for open-heart surgery. Use this tool to find and compare providers.

name: China’s Memory Hole: The Images Erased From Sina Weibo
creator: Propublica
description: "ProPublica has been collecting images that have been deleted by censors from Sina Weibo, "China’s Twitter," since May. We gathered a team of people proficient in Mandarin to read and interpret 527 deleted images collected during a two-week window this summer. The images provide a window into the Chinese elite’s self-image and its fears, as well as a lens through which to understand China’s vast system of censorship."
